intro: Ebenus hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and small, clustered flowers. Native to arid and semi-arid regions of Europe and Asia, it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces yellowish or greenish flowers that bloom in early spring. Its adaptations to harsh environments include succulent leaves and a compact growth form.
